intro: Galium idubedae var. humile, commonly known as the dwarf bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically oval to lance-shaped. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers during the summer months, which are arranged in cymes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium idubedae var. humile is often found in temperate regions and is noted for its delicate appearance and ecological significance in supporting local insect populations.
